career_path: Associate Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Manager (2-3 yrs) → Associate Partner (3-4 yrs) → Partner

recruiting.process: Application → Online Assessment (45-min GMAT-style + HireVue) → First Round (2 case + 2 fit) → Final Round (2-4 interviews with Partners)
recruiting.unique: 45-minute GMAT-style online assessment required before first round. Cases are highly interactive and commercially focused—closer to MBB rigor with heavy probing and little tolerance for vague answers. Some offices include written case exercise in final round.
recruiting.timeline: Applications open mid-August, close end of September for undergrads. MBA windows: Sept-Oct (full-time), Oct-Jan (internships). Feedback within 3 weeks of closing date. Non-rolling—all applications reviewed after deadline.

byu.tip: Very limited BYU pipeline—only 1 current alum. Focus networking on consumer/retail projects and emphasize analytical rigor. Their B Corp status suggests they value purpose-driven candidates.

name: Oliver Wyman
tagline: Financial services specialist—deep risk and actuarial expertise within Marsh McLennan
description: We guide clients through high-stakes decisions and transformative moments so they can adapt, grow, and thrive. Our edge? The power of perspective — driven by deep industry insight, specialized expertise, and a spirit of true collaboration.
known_for: Founded by former Booz Allen partners in 1984 as a financial services specialist. Known for rigorous analytical approach, deep actuarial expertise, and strong risk management capabilities. Part of Marsh McLennan—maintains specialized focus while resisting generalist diversification.
career_path: Analyst (2-3 yrs) → Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Associate (2-3 yrs) → Engagement Manager (3-4 yrs) → Partner

recruiting.process: Application → Phone Screen (case + fit) → First Round (2 interviews: 1 case + 1 fit) → Final Round (3 interviews: 1 case + 1 written case + 1 fit)
recruiting.unique: Written case exercise in final round. Strong emphasis on financial services and risk management scenarios.
recruiting.timeline: Applications open July-August, rolling review. Process takes 2-3 months total, typically 14 days between steps. Interviews begin late August-October.

byu.tip: Small BYU presence—leverage financial services or actuarial background. Network with alumni in Boston and New York offices where financial services hiring is strongest.

name: Palm Tree LLC
tagline: Private equity-focused M&A advisor born out of PE
description: As a single-source partner, Palm Tree integrates financial, operational, analytical, and capital solutions to advise and execute value-creation initiatives that drive transactions, transitions, and transformations. We guide private equity firms through high-stakes processes, engaging with them to highlight opportunities, mitigate risks, and reduce deal friction. Our integrated services work alongside management teams to help them prepare for, navigate, and succeed in strategic events so they can focus on company performance and preserving operational capacity. We were born out of private equity. It gives us the resilience, flexibility, and perspective of owners and operators. Our team comes from private equity, Big-4 accounting, investment banking, and business operations experience.
known_for: The modern M&A advisor for private equity, Palm Tree is unique as a one-stop-shop specializing in the full PE deal lifecycle. With 600+ engagements across 6 continents totaling $75B+ in transaction value, they bring hands-on expertise from private equity, Big-4, and investment banking backgrounds.
career_path: Analyst (2-3 yrs) → Senior Analyst (2-3 yrs) → Associate (2-3 yrs) → Vice President → Principal

recruiting.process: Resume → Behavioral Round (recruiting team) → Peer Fit Interview → Case Study (4-6 hrs) → Technical Review (1 hr with senior member) → Final Rounds (culture fit)
recruiting.unique: Extended 4-6 hour case study conducted off-hours or over the weekend, followed by detailed technical review with senior leadership
recruiting.timeline: Rolling applications year-round, 3-4 weeks from application to offer

byu.tip: Limited BYU presence—network with the single current alumnus and reach out directly to LA office recruiters

name: Point B
tagline: Employee-owned firm balancing impact with work-life quality
description: Trusted by the world's leading organizations, Point B is a consulting company that drives impact at the intersection of expertise, industry insight, and transformative technology. This collaborative approach enables you to solve your most important challenges by bringing together the right mix of talent and technology to deliver greater value and impact. With over 850 associates in the US and 3,000+ consultants around the world through our partnership with Nextcontinent, we work where you do to deliver the change you seek.
known_for: Founded in 1995 by three former consultants seeking to build an alternative to traditional big-firm consulting, Point B is 100% employee-owned (ESOP) with a distinctive focus on work-life balance. The firm promotes 'wrapping work around life' with local staffing options, flexible PTO, and 40-45 hour work weeks—significantly more balanced than MBB firms. Partnered with Endeavour (PE firm) and Nextcontinent (global consulting network).
career_path: Analyst (2-3 yrs) → Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Senior Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Manager (3-4 yrs) → Director (4+ yrs) → Partner

recruiting.process: Application → Phone Screen → Multiple Interview Rounds (behavioral + case scenarios) → Potential Written Work Sample/Business Case Presentation → Offer
recruiting.unique: May include take-home business case with slide presentation; case interviews are not always administered; focuses heavily on cultural fit and work-life values; process is generally regarded as easier than MBB interviews
recruiting.timeline: Process typically takes 3-7 weeks from application to offer; rolling applications for experienced hires; structured recruiting for students and recent graduates

byu.tip: No BYU alumni presence detected. Focus on demonstrating cultural fit with Point B's work-life balance values and employee ownership model. Highlight interest in technology-enabled transformation and local market staffing preferences.

name: Porsche Consulting
tagline: Automotive excellence meets lean operations—'Strategic Vision, Smart Implementation' from Porsche's DNA
known_for: Born from Porsche's successful turnaround in the 1990s, Porsche Consulting brings automotive operational excellence to clients worldwide. Known for 'Strategic Vision, Smart Implementation'—combining strategic thinking with pragmatic, hands-on execution. Deep expertise in lean manufacturing, supply chain optimization, and end-to-end transformation.
career_path: Analyst → Consultant (2 yrs) → Senior Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Manager (3-4 yrs) → Senior Manager → Senior Expert → Associate Partner → Partner

recruiting.process: Application → HR Phone Screen (30 min, fit questions) → Case Interview Round (CV presentation + market sizing/business case + fit) → Final Round (additional cases + partner interviews)
recruiting.unique: Expect Porsche-specific questions like 'What is your favorite Porsche model and why?' Cases focus on operational and automotive topics. Very friendly, 'humane' interview style with 10-15 min prep time for market sizing cases. Firm is extremely proud of Porsche heritage.
recruiting.timeline: Process takes approximately 6 weeks from application to offer

name: Putnam (Inizio Advisory)
tagline: Life sciences strategy boutique bridging science and business decisions
description: We are now Inizio Ignite, the global advisory partner for health and life sciences, encompassing connected expertise across Research Partnership, Putnam, Vynamic, and STEM. Our Putnam strategy consulting team bridges science and strategy to enable confident decision-making and build value for pharma. We partner with leading health and life science companies serving brand & commercial leaders, Medical Affairs, access & pricing, and R&D. Our expertise spans offerings including therapeutic area strategy, data & AI strategy, go-to-market strategy, commercialization & growth, value, pricing & access (VPA) strategy, and evidence generation. Proudly part of Inizio – the market-leading commercialization partner for health and life sciences. From early-stage development to loss of exclusivity, we simplify complexity, unlock value, and make collaboration seamless at every pivotal moment – supporting confident, insight-driven decisions that move innovation forward.
known_for: Founded by ex-Bain consultants in 1988, Putnam is a leading life sciences strategy boutique serving all top 20 global biopharma companies. Known for deep scientific expertise, minimal travel requirements (under 25%), and strong work-life balance compared to traditional consulting firms.
career_path: Associate Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Senior Associate (2-3 yrs) → Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Senior Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Manager (3-4 yrs) → Principal (3-4 yrs) → Partner

recruiting.process: Resume Screen → Phone Interview (behavioral, for non-core schools) → First Round (2 case interviews + behavioral) → Final Round (2 case + 1 behavioral + Q&A)
recruiting.unique: Heavy focus on healthcare and life sciences cases including drug pricing, product launch strategy, and market sizing. Behavioral interviews emphasize Putnam's core values around teamwork, leadership, and grit. Candidate-led case format.
recruiting.timeline: 2-4 weeks from application to offer. Hear back within 2-5 business days between rounds. Offers extended within 48-72 hours after final round.

byu.tip: No current BYU pipeline. Focus on networking with life sciences professionals and highlighting any biology, chemistry, or health-related coursework. Consider gaining research experience or biotech industry exposure to strengthen your profile.

name: PwC Consulting
tagline: Big 4 scale with execution-focused consulting from strategy through implementation
description: Preparing for tomorrow's workforce, today. At PwC, we help clients transform their businesses today in order to thrive tomorrow. As we all experience fundamental shifts in the way we work, our team is taking a holistic approach that encompasses business strategy, as well as operational, technological, regulatory, social and tax considerations to help our clients navigate the future.
known_for: PwC Consulting is known for execution-focused work that goes beyond strategy to implementation. Part of the Big 4, they combine deep industry expertise with the scale and resources to deliver complex projects end-to-end, from C-suite strategy down to operational details. Strong reputation for technology transformation, risk management, and helping organizations navigate regulatory complexity.
career_path: Associate (2-3 yrs) → Senior Associate (2-3 yrs) → Manager (2-3 yrs) → Senior Manager (2-3 yrs) → Director (3-4 yrs) → Managing Director (3-4 yrs) → Partner

recruiting.process: Application → Online Assessment (Numerical, Verbal, Inductive Reasoning) → Digital Interview → First Round (Behavioral with Recruiter) → Second Round (2 case + 2 behavioral) → Final Round (2-3 case + behavioral, possible group case or written case)
recruiting.unique: Online assessments required before interviews. Interviewer-led case format. Some offices use group case exercises during assessment day, especially for undergrad internship recruiting.
recruiting.timeline: Applications open in fall, interviews October-November, rolling basis. 4-6 weeks from application to offer typical.

byu.tip: PwC has strong BYU connections with 24 current BYU alumni. Network with alumni across their 70+ US offices to find the best location fit for your interests and desired industry exposure.

name: Strategy&
tagline: Former Booz & Company—pure strategy arm within Big 4
description: Strategy& became part of the PwC network in 2014, following the transformation from Booz & Company. Strategy, made real.
known_for: Prestigious strategy heritage from Booz & Company (founded 1914), acquired by PwC in 2014 in the largest consulting acquisition in PwC history. Known for capabilities-driven strategy approach and access to PwC's global network while maintaining strategy consulting focus.
career_path: Associate (2-3 yrs) → Senior Associate (2-3 yrs) → Manager (2-3 yrs) → Director (2-3 yrs) → Partner

recruiting.process: Application → Resume Screen → First Round (2 case + fit/behavioral) → Final Round (2 case + fit/behavioral)
recruiting.unique: Group case exercise sometimes used for undergraduate internship applicants. Roughly half of interview time spent on case, half on behavioral/fit questions.
recruiting.timeline: Rolling basis (most opportunities), 4-6 weeks from application to decision, shorter timeline (2 weeks) for referrals

byu.tip: Apply through Strategy& portal specifically, not general PwC careers site—they have separate recruiting processes.

name: Roland Berger
tagline: Europe's leading independent strategy consultancy with global reach
description: Roland Berger is a global leader in strategy consulting, renowned for its focus on transformation, innovation, and sustainability. Founded in 1967 and headquartered in Munich, we shape the future of businesses and industries globally. Whether it's digitalization, globalization, or sustainability, we see challenges as opportunities to drive impact. With innovative solutions, deep industry expertise, and agile international teams, we deliver measurable results and lasting change. Our goal is clear: accelerate transformation, build resilient business models, and contribute to a CO2-neutral future – bold, collaborative, and impactful.
known_for: The only native European strategy consultancy with global presence, Roland Berger is top 3 in Europe and top 10 globally. Known for entrepreneurial culture, strong industrial sector expertise (especially automotive and chemicals), and practical implementation focus rather than purely theoretical frameworks.
career_path: Analyst (2-3 yrs) → Junior Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Senior Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Project Manager (2-3 yrs) → Director (3-4 yrs) → Principal (3-4 yrs) → Partner

recruiting.process: Resume & Cover Letter → Online Reasoning Test (90 min: numerical, verbal, figurative) → First Round (case + fit) → Final Round (written case + fit + business knowledge discussion)
recruiting.unique: 90-minute online reasoning test similar to GMAT. Final round includes 'business knowledge discussion' which is like an unstructured case. Emphasis on entrepreneurial drive in fit interviews. All candidates receive feedback regardless of outcome.

byu.tip: No BYU alumni network at Roland Berger. Focus networking on European offices where firm has strongest brand, or target US offices (Boston, Chicago, Detroit) through cold outreach. Emphasize entrepreneurial mindset and willingness to take initiative—highly valued in RB's startup-like culture.

name: Simon-Kucher & Partners
tagline: World's leading pricing and commercial growth specialist
description: Simon-Kucher is a global consultancy with more than 2,000 employees in 30+ countries. Our sole focus is on unlocking better growth that drives measurable revenue and profit for our clients. We achieve this by optimizing every lever of their commercial strategy – product, price, innovation, marketing, and sales – based on deep insights into what customers want and value. With nearly 40 years of experience in monetization topics of all kinds, we are regarded as the world's leading pricing and growth specialist. (Legal notice: https://www.simon-kucher.com/en/legal-notice) -- Terms of use: Simon-Kucher's official LinkedIn page is run by Simon-Kucher & Partners Strategy & Marketing Consultants (SK). This is a public forum and we welcome your comments, thoughts and insights. However, all posts are regularly monitored and SK will remove, hide and/or delete any that are found to be abusive or deemed inappropriate for this page for whatever reason, including content that is deemed none compliant with LinkedIn's User Agreement (https://www.linkedin.com/legal/user-agreement). This includes the banning and reporting of users who are deemed to be non compliant with the above expectations of Simon-Kucher. All comments, visuals, links to other digital pages and other type of material posted by followers on this site ("User Content") do not necessarily reflect the opinions or values of SK, its employees, partners or affiliates. SK does not represent or warrant the accuracy of any statement or product claims made here, is not responsible for any User Content on this site and does not endorse any opinions expressed on this page.
known_for: Founded in 1985 as a university spinoff, Simon-Kucher pioneered the field of pricing strategy and has become the world's leading pricing and growth specialist. The firm claims projects increase client profitability by 100-500 basis points on average. Unlike generalist consultancies, Simon-Kucher focuses exclusively on commercial growth—optimizing product, price, innovation, marketing, and sales with scientific rigor.
career_path: Consultant (1.5-2 yrs) → Senior Consultant (1.5-2 yrs) → Manager (2 yrs) → Director (2-3 yrs) → Partner

recruiting.process: Application → First Round (2 interviews: case + fit) → Final Round (3 interviews: case + fit)
recruiting.unique: Strong emphasis on pricing cases reflecting firm's specialization; candidate-led format; cases focus on monetization, revenue growth, and sales excellence rather than pure strategy
recruiting.timeline: Approximately 26 days from application to offer; 3-4 rounds total combining behavioral, quantitative, and case interviews

byu.tip: Very limited BYU presence (only 1 current alum). Focus on cold networking through LinkedIn and target partners/managers in Boston, New York, or San Francisco offices. Emphasize quantitative skills and pricing/revenue optimization interests.

name: Slalom
tagline: Tech-enabled consulting with no unwanted travel—local delivery model and strong work-life balance
known_for: Unique local delivery model with 'no unwanted travel' policy that allows consultants to work where they live. Strong Microsoft partnership (Gold Partner since 2005) and tech implementation expertise. Historically praised for superior work-life balance compared to traditional consulting firms.
career_path: Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Senior Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Principal (3-4 yrs) → Director (3-4 yrs) → Managing Director

recruiting.process: Application → Phone Screen (behavioral) → Virtual Interview Rounds (2-3 case + behavioral) → Final Round (case + behavioral + potential written case)
recruiting.unique: Lighter emphasis on case interviews compared to traditional consulting firms. Heavy focus on behavioral questions and cultural fit. Values candidates with some professional experience.
recruiting.timeline: 3-4 weeks from application to decision. Rolling applications throughout the year.

byu.tip: Leverage BYU alumni network, particularly in Seattle and Denver offices. Strong fit for candidates interested in technology consulting with better work-life balance. Salt Lake City office may be particularly BYU-friendly given proximity to Utah.

name: Stax (Grant Thornton)
tagline: PE-focused strategy firm specializing in commercial due diligence and value creation
description: Grant Thornton Stax is a global strategy consulting firm specializing in commercial due diligence, value creation, and exit planning for private equity firms, PE-backed companies, hedge funds, and investment banks across a broad range of industries including software/technology, industrials, business services, healthcare, consumer, and the events ecosystem. The firm partners with clients to provide data-driven, actionable insights designed to drive growth, enhance profits, increase value, and make better investment decisions. Stax is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Grant Thornton Advisors LLC. Grant Thornton International Limited (GTIL) and the member firms, including Grant Thornton LLP and Grant Thornton Advisors LLC, are not a worldwide partnership. Services are delivered by the member firms. GTIL and its member firms are not agents of, and do not obligate, one another and are not liable for one another's acts or omissions.
known_for: Leading PE-focused strategy firm with deep commercial due diligence expertise and limited-travel model. Ranked #1 for work-life balance in EMEA (Vault 2025). Acquired by Grant Thornton in 2025, serving nearly 70% of the PE International 300.
career_path: Associate Consultant (18-24 mos) → Consultant (18-24 mos) → Senior Consultant (18-24 mos) → Manager (3-5 yrs) → Senior Manager (3-5 yrs) → Director → Managing Director

recruiting.process: Application → Phone Screen → First Round (45-min behavioral + 45-min case) → Second Round (behavioral + Excel test + case) → Final Round (30-min behavioral with partner)
recruiting.unique: Excel modeling test with Q&A in second round - distinctive focus on analytical modeling and presentation skills. Atypical case questions with back-and-forth discussion. May include slide re-arrangement exercise.
recruiting.timeline: Process typically takes 2-3 weeks from application to offer. Average 17 days reported across all roles.

byu.tip: Very limited BYU presence - requires aggressive networking. Focus on Boston, New York, or Chicago offices. Highlight any private equity or Excel modeling experience.

name: West Monroe
tagline: Business and technology consulting with employee ownership culture
description: West Monroe is a global business and technology consulting firm passionate about creating value for our clients. We co-create solutions that accelerate results now and prepare industries to tackle what's next. We're excited by the possibilities that technology creates. We work with our clients to deliver on the possible, building on their goals, generating fresh insights and creating inspiring outcomes. We excel at the intersection of industry, strategy, people and technology—always driving rapid impact. Our all-in approach comes from our unique employee ownership structure. Our clients' success is our success. From the beginning, our growth has come from putting people at the center. Fortune and USA Today consistently celebrate West Monroe as a top workplace, and we're recognized as a leading consultancy by Forbes and Forrester. Share our passion at westmonroe.com.
known_for: West Monroe combines business and technology consulting expertise with a unique 50/50 employee-MSD Partners ownership structure. Known for middle-market focus, practical implementations, and award-winning culture. Great Place To Work Certified for 10+ consecutive years.
career_path: Analyst (2-3 yrs) → Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Senior Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Manager (3-4 yrs) → Senior Manager (3-4 yrs) → Director → Partner

recruiting.process: Application → Video Interview (HireVue - 2 behavioral questions) → Super Day (3 interviews: Case + Skills + Behavioral, 45 min each)
recruiting.unique: Story-driven case studies from real West Monroe projects, conversational interview style rather than rigid Q&A format
recruiting.timeline: Sophomore Series program for rising juniors, fall recruiting for full-time roles, 3-5 interviews total with different employees

byu.tip: No current BYU alumni pipeline. Focus on networking through industry events and reaching out to consultants in target offices (Chicago, Dallas, Seattle). Strong fit for students with tech + business backgrounds.

name: ZS Associates
tagline: Life sciences powerhouse combining data science and consulting expertise
description: ZS is a management consulting and technology firm that partners with companies to improve life and how we live it. We transform ideas into impact by bringing together data, science, technology and human ingenuity to deliver better outcomes for all. Founded in 1983, ZS has more than 13,000 employees in over 35 offices worldwide. To learn more, visit www.zs.com/ At ZS, our mission is to inspire each other to bring our unique perspective and experience to work each day. When you join our firm, you have access to a wealth of community groups to support you, energize you and inspire you to bring your authentic self to work each day.
known_for: ZS is recognized as the leading consulting firm in life sciences and healthcare, with deep expertise in commercial strategy, sales force effectiveness, and advanced analytics. Founded by two Northwestern professors, ZS combines rigorous quantitative methods with hands-on implementation capabilities.
career_path: Associate (2 yrs) → Associate Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Manager (3 yrs) → Associate Principal (3-4 yrs) → Principal

recruiting.process: Application → Online Assessment (quant, verbal, logical) → Video Interview (8 video questions + 3 written) → Case Interviews (2-4 rounds) → Behavioral Interviews
recruiting.unique: Video interview with timed responses (30 sec to think, 3 min to answer), plus written brain teasers. Heavy focus on analytics and quantitative problem-solving throughout the process.
recruiting.timeline: Campus recruiting in fall, 2-4 weeks response time during busy season

byu.tip: Focus on healthcare and life sciences interests when networking—ZS values deep industry knowledge alongside analytical skills
